entry.title: Jet Set for Security: Israel's F-15 Deal and the Future of Cyber Defense
entry.summary: Recently, significant developments have emerged in the global defense and technology sectors. Israel has signed a deal with Boeing Co. to acquire 25 F-15 fighter jets, a move that underscores the country's ongoing commitment to modernizing its military capabilities amid regional tensions. This acquisition highlights the strategic partnership between Israel and the United States, particularly in defense procurement. Meanwhile, in the technology realm, ServiceNow has announced its intention to acquire Mission Secure, a company focused on enhancing operational technology (OT) asset visibility. This acquisition aims to bolster ServiceNow's offerings in cybersecurity and asset management, reflecting a growing emphasis on securing critical infrastructure in an increasingly digital world. Together, these developments illustrate the intertwining of military and technological advancements as nations and companies seek to navigate complex security landscapes.
